Questions.QuestionString: What is the N2 speed sensor located on?
How many speed sensors on PW1100G?
Where is the PHMU located?
PHMU is monitoring…?
Answers: Oil Debris monitoring, Vibration monitoring, Auxiliary Oil pressure Monitoring
Oil Debris monitoring, Auxiliary Oil pressure Monitoring

Questions.QuestionString: How many EGT thermocouple on PW1100G?
What is the Cold Junction Compensation to compute EGT?
How many vibration sensors on PW1100G?
The engine primary parameters are displayed on?
Answers: Both The lower ECAM engine page and the upper ECAM

Questions.QuestionString: The engine page is selected?
Answers: Manually or automatically depending on flight phases
Automatically only depending on flight phases

Questions.QuestionString: The engine “N2 SPEED” parameter is displayed on?
Answers: The Lower ECAM engine page or Cruise page

Questions.QuestionString: The engine oil quantity parameters are displayed on?
Answers: The Lower ECAM engine page or Cruise page

Questions.QuestionString: The IGN indication is displayed on?
Answers: The Upper ECAM during engine start
The Lower ECAM engine page during engine start
The Lower ECAM engine page or Cruise page

Questions.QuestionString: The fuel used indication is reset to Zero:
Answers: Five minutes after engine shut down

Questions.QuestionString: The engine thrust indicated on ECAM via what parameter?
For PW 1130 Engine, with the Ignition system of the engine is supplied with power as follows:
Answers: 115 V from the A/C electrical system
115 V from PMA or 115 V from the A/C electrical system depending on N2 speed

Questions.QuestionString: For PW 1130 Engine, the Ignition system is controlled by:
A fan cowl loss prevention system is installed with:
Answers: Mechanically with a flag and Electrically monitored by proximity switches
Electrically monitored by proximity switches only

Questions.QuestionString: The fan speed (Nf) is used:
Answers: By the EEC to detect decoupling of the fan shaft and by the PHMU to calculate trim balance solutions
By the EEC to control the thrust

Questions.QuestionString: The engine EGT is sensed and averaged by
EEC and PHMU are cooled by:
Sensor T3 transmits signal:
Answers: Of temperature from 3rd stage of HPC
Of temperature from last stage of HPC
Of temperature from 3rd stage of LPT

Questions.QuestionString: The PHMU (Prognostics and Health Management Unit) communicates with EEC via:
The N1 & N2 speed sensors send signals direct to
If the signal from one vibration sensor (either forward or aft vibration sensor) is lost during engine operation, the display for the affected sensor will be presented in
What are indication ENG speed sensors on the ECAM?
What are purposes of Prognostics and Health Management Unit (PHMU)?
Answers: Monitor and process levels for engine oil debris and rotor vibration
Respond to requests from avionics system that are received through EEC
